H0.text: Identifying experimental variables is the starting point for a new scientific investigation.

H1.text: Forming a question that is the basis of a hypothesis is the starting point for a new scientific investigation.

H2.text: Conducting repeated trials and graphing the data is the starting point for a new scientific investigation.

H3.text: Writing out a procedure and collecting the needed equipment is the starting point for a new scientific investigation.

A5.text: Scientific measurements are usually tabulated, graphed, or mapped.

A6.text: A working hypothesis is a provisionally-accepted hypothesis used for the purpose of pursuing further progress in research.
